content.description:
Being kinda short and a little lichenous keeps the stars low on this classic line.  

  The business is defined with first and second digit locks thru tight hands.  

  Aren't all these cracks the same size, though...Its been about 10 years since I've been here but I remember the splitter goodness and lovin' those TCU's!
content.protection: 0, (2)1, (2)2 TCU's - 2.5 Friend size cams, sm/med wired nuts

climbs.name: Rim Job
climbs.fa: Michael Lawson, Gerald Guidroz, Brad Walker,  1986

content.description: Start on Papooshka, then climb the tips to fingers splitter on the left side of the ledge. I exited left for the top-out.
content.protection: purple metolius to 1 camelot. As big as 3 camelot for the start
content.location: Start in a blocky corner that arches right. Not as bad as it looks, but heads up.

content.description: Short climb up triple cracks, starting from the lower of two mid-height staggered ledges.  Mostly via the wider right crack, via cupped hands and fists against coarse rock.
content.protection: BD #3's and #4's, plus couple of finger sizes if placing into the other two slightly overhanging thinner cracks.  Could anchor belayer on starting ledge with #2 to #4.
content.location: When facing out and looking across at The Prow, look for a 4-5 ft tall lone standing outcrop on the rim just to the skier's right of a prominent slanting tree.  The route's topout is around the skier's right side of that outcrop, wrapping ccw to its outer face (could see the staggered starting ledges below).

content.description: This is a good climb to get on if your fingers are fat.  The first half of the climb is tricky to protect, but lots of fun.  From the big ledge half way up, follow the beautiful big fingers crack in a dihedral.  Much harder for small fingered folk.
content.protection: 2 each to #2 Camalot, 1 #3 Camalot, extra 0.4 Camalot and 0.5 Camalot size.
content.location: Left to right on the Obscenity wall:Toad's Stool is the flared finger crack below the big pine tree.Red Snapper is the 3 wide cracks below the big pine tree.Fingering the Avatar is the clean dihedral just a little down canyon from the big pine tree.Rap to the ground and climb broken rock to get to the dihedral.

content.description:
Easy, broken and a little bit dirty.

 Start in a left facing corner with blocky, loose looking stone. There is a very good 1 camelot placement approx 12' up. The corner arches to the right, then easy ground leads to the ledge.

 Next climb the the short, thin hands to big hands crack. Right side of the ledge, left side of the pillar. One more move protects well with a medium stopper.
content.location: Approx 15 feet right of the start for Fingering the Avatar. Fingering the Avatar starts in the improbable, black cavelike feature. Papooshka starts in the unpleasant looking left facing corner. The start is not as bad as it looks, but heads up.

content.description: Obscenity Wall is the next wall down canyon from Sine Wall. The best routes are Toad's Stool, a short but classic line similar to Davidson's Dihedral, and Fingering the Avatar.The rock on the top half of the wall is excelent, and the rock on the bottom half is not. For this reason, a lot of the climbs start on ledges half way up.
